wikipedia_page.main: Edward Gordon Dundas Wright (3 October 1884 – 5 June 1947) was an English amateur footballer who competed in the 1912 Summer Olympics. He was the captain of Hull City team for seven seasons in a row. He was part of the English team, who won the gold medal in the football tournament. He played one match in this team.
